text:
web.xml:

--begin--
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?>
<!DOCTYPE web-app PUBLIC "-//Sun Microsystems, Inc.//DTD Web Application 
2.3//EN" "http://java.sun.com/dtd/web-app_2_3.dtd">
<web-app>
  <servlet>
    <servlet-name>Demo</servlet-name>
    <servlet-class>Demo</ervlet-class>
  </servlet>

  <servlet-mapping>
    <servlet-name>Demo</servlet-name>
    <url-pattern>/</url-pattern>
  </servlet-mapping>
</web-app>
--end--

I would like to map "http://host/context" to the Demo servlet by using the 
above web.xml.  But, it seems that all the request to the above context will be 
map to Demo too (e.g., http://host/context/foo.html will be map to Hello too)!  
The "/" url-pattern just act like "/*".
creator: helium_wong@hotmail.com

text: This is exactly the behavior that is specified by the servlet 2.3 spec.
creator: william.barker@wilshire.com

text:
Then, how can I map / only (not /*) to a particular Servlet?  By use filter?
Thanks.
